parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma1

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Program Flow

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Creates a switch type that can be used inside a [[switch do|switch-do]] block.
<br><br>
<template lineStart="1"><title>Feature </title><part><name index="1"/><value> important </value></part><part><name index="2"/><value> When it comes to strings, switch case matching is <b>case-sensitive</b></value></part></template>

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> [[switch]] condition

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> condition: [[Anything]]

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Switch Type]]

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>[[private]] _mySwitch = [[switch]] "Test";
_mySwitch [[do]] { <template><title>codecomment</title><part><name index="1"/><value>/* Something */</value></part></template> };</code>

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>[[switch]] (_condition) [[do]] {
    [[case]] 1: { [[hint]] "1" };
    [[case]] 2: { [[hint]] "2" };
    [[default]] { [[hint]] "default" };
};</code>

</value></part><part><name>x3</name>=<value>
<code>[[switch]] (_condition) [[do]] {
    [[case]] "string1";
    [[case]] "string2": { [[hint]] "string1 or string2" };
    [[case]] "string3";
    [[case]] "string4": { [[hint]] "string3 or string4" };
    [[default]] { [[hint]] "default" };
};</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[Control Structures]] [[switch do]] [[a:b]] [[case]] [[default]]
</value></part></template>

<dl class="command_description">

<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment>
<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>


[[Category:Scripting Commands|<template><title>uc:<template><title>PAGENAME</title></template></title></template>]]
